quiz.title: Economics: Demand Shifts, Elasticity, and Price Controls

questions.question: A rightward shift of the demand curve indicates:
questions.explanation: A rightward shift means that at each price, consumers are willing to buy moreâ€”an increase in demand.

questions.question: If demand is perfectly inelastic, the demand curve is:
questions.explanation: Perfectly inelastic demand means quantity demanded does not change at all when price changes, so the demand curve is vertical.

questions.question: What is the shape of the demand curve faced by a firm under perfect competition?
questions.explanation: A perfectly competitive firm is a price taker; it can sell any quantity at the market price, so its demand curve is perfectly elastic (horizontal).

questions.question: The equilibrium price for good X is $20. If the government places a ceiling of $10, what would this result in?
questions.explanation: A price ceiling below equilibrium ($10 < $20) creates excess demand (quantity demanded > quantity supplied), leading to a shortage.
